WorkItem.Description:
XLSX file generated by PHPExcel causes Excel2007 to crash when you try to do print preview, print or save as PDF. You can workaround the issue by opening the file, saving it (size increases slightly), CLOSING Excel, opening the file again and yep, it works!
 
Even the simplest 01sample.xlsx from Examples wiki page causes this.
 
After some time of tweaking XLSX inner structure and comparing generated and by-Excel-saved file (I'm not XLSX expert) I have discovered that the cause is lack of bookViews element and its subelements in workbook.xml file. When I add these elements from Excel-saved file (<bookViews><workbookView xWindow="240" yWindow="540" windowWidth="24615" windowHeight="13485"/></bookViews>) it works. When I uncomment _writeBookViews in Workbook.php (writes different attributes) it also works.
 
The question is - why is _writeBookViews commented out?
WorkItem.Summary: Print and print preview of generated XLSX causes Excel2007 to crash

Comments.Message: Here's the reason... http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=2513Try uncommenting it, and running test 05featuredemo.php. You'll notice that the generated xlsx file does not show any calculated values.
